newsitem.title: UK: UK grains close lower on lack of follow-through.
newsitem.headline: UK grains close lower on lack of follow-through.

text.p: UK wheat futures drifted lower on Tuesday, mainly due to a lack of follow-through from buyers.
"Buyers have stopped chasing the market and prices are drifting as a result," said a trader.
Barley was also lower with traders forecasting only a limited amount of the barley for Saudi Arabia coming from the UK market.
"It doesn't look as if the UK market is going to get as much of the Saudi tender as was first thought," said another trader.
Others said the Saudi business had been built into prices over the past few days, so a downturn was only to be expected.
The result of the Saudi Arabian tender has yet to be confirmed but reports suggest it has bought 1.4 million tonnes of barley for import from October to December.
UK wheat futures closed 0.35 to 0.75 stg down after trading 400 lots while barley finished 0.25 to 0.50 stg lower on a turnover of 32 lots.
Amsterdam milling wheat futures were again neglected.
Cash trade in the UK was quiet with fob prices around 0.50 stg down while delivered market traders reported little activity.
